name: group.pointToEach()
content:
Rotate every sprite ionthe group to face the (x,y) coordinate.

In some animations or games you need sprites to point in the direction of a mouse action or another sprite. You can get the x and y coordinates from the mouse or sprite.

palette_params.name: x
palette_params.description: The x-coordinate you want the sprites to turn towards. Usually a number from 0 to 400, but smaller or larger numbers off the display area will also work.

palette_params.name: y
palette_params.description: The y-coordinate you want the sprites to turn towards. Usually a number from 0 to 400, but smaller or larger numbers off the display area will also work.

return_value: No return value. Changes output in the display after drawSprites() is called.
short_description: Rotate every sprite ionthe group to face the (x,y) coordinate.
tips:
- Groups of sprites all have the same functions and you use the dot notation (combining the name of the group, followed by a dot, with the function name) to call the function for that group of sprites.
- Any changes to the properties of a sprite will not be seen until after `drawSprites()` is called.
